parts:
('You are stuck in a mapworld environment. Your task is to explore this world and reach an escape room.
Start by describing the image given to you that represents the current room you are in.
You can also make moves to the following rooms - [('Home theater', 'south'), ('Convenience store outdoor', 'west')], here the first part is the room name and the second part is the direction which leads to
the room. You are allowed to respond only in the following format.

{"description": A one line description of the current room you are in, "moves": [list of tuples of possible moves to rooms]}',)
https://www.ling.uni-potsdam.de/clembench/adk/images/ADE/training/home_or_hotel/childs_room/ADE_train_00005486.jpg
{"description": "A child's bedroom with a daybed, nautical-themed artwork, and a beanbag chair.", "moves": [('Home theater', 'south'), ('Convenience store outdoor', 'west')]}
https://www.ling.uni-potsdam.de/clembench/adk/images/ADE/training/urban/convenience_store__outdoor/ADE_train_00006220.jpg

raw_response_obj.text:

"A child's nautical-themed bedroom featuring a daybed and beanbag chair."

"Cozy child's bedroom with a nautical theme.  A daybed provides a comfortable sleeping space, complemented by a beanbag chair and charming nautical artwork."

**Option 3 (Adding context from the moves):**
